formatted_address: BLK 631 Ang Mo Kio Ave 4, #01-906, Singapore 560631
name: 631 Teochew Fish Porridge Da Pai Dang

reviews.text: Ordered their È±ºÁâáÁ±≥Á≤â and is the most expensive one I ever seem - $12 for a small portion with minimal number of fish slices (4-5). Only upside is their fish is indeed fresh. Their soup is quite garlicky and I am a fan of garlic, so it suits my personal preference, but even so is just decent and nothing to rave about. Their service is pretty bad. I was clarifying with the female cashier/server regarding the fish options for the day and she talked to me in a nonchalant manner and barely looked at me. She wasn‚Äôt even busy at that point in time cause I was the only customer. When I confirmed with her the price I was supposed to pay and she didn‚Äôt even respond to me. I am utterly appalled by her service and attitude. Such food is definitely not worth the price and the attitude.

IF ONLY I CAN GIVE ZERO 00000000 STARS! See photos for prove. I was literally eating vegs n rice. Husband too angry to swallow, straight away bought the 925 chicken rice(super yummy).

*Gonna be a LONG post!

I'm definitely not the 1st person to give such low review on them. Just search all the 1 star reviews. I usually write praises.. but wow, they really pissed us off max.

I'm going to use all my accounts plus my friends account to review. This my honest review as a customer! I really Wana save everyone money n from getting so pissed off like us.

1 star for the cashier, she still tried her best to explain when I ask to come take a look, I merely even touch my rice, n the fish is gone. But come on, this not the first time eating fish soup, no need to educate me on how U guys calculate what grams how much n all.

Today 20th Dec 2024, my 2nd visit(1st visit was 2 years ago, experience was ok!  Tats y I return, But NOT TODAY!)

Pls guys, do not come. So many other fish stall, go support others!

From the picture U can see, when we bought the 2nd expensive $25 king grouper for 2 person, + rice is abt $26+, I separated the vegs out coz only I eat that, the I scooped abt 3 pieces of fish with soup for each of us, then when I go for 2nd scoop, I was shocked, I scooped n scooped, only left another 3 pieces of fish. N their fish is pretty thin kind.

We couldn't let that go, our rice was just eaten 3 mouth. We ask the cashier to come see, n she tried to explain n left. ZERO customer service recovery, if she just say Mayb is calculated wrongly or something n topup a few more pieces for us, n Mayb we can just matches our rice n finish our lunch, we will close 1 eye.

We were so pissed off couldn't even continue the meal n went to get chicken rice to fill our stomach. I had a video, too bad only can post pictures here. Anyway I'll post on all my social media.

We still see quite a number of people order after us. but they are all ordering 1 person soup. I guess 1 person soup, they can't give 4 pieces, so no one complain yet.

To end off, JUST DO NO GO!

Total rip off.. I've ordered the $25 claypot grouper soup based on 2 pax and was given around 10+ pieces of thinly sliced fish.. never going back to this stall ever.. don't recommend anyone to patronise either.. there are better fish soup elsewhere.. felt so cheated..

I don't like fish or any kind; period. But if it's the last thing available at any given day, this fish soup stall at 631; I gladly pay and eat. There are different types of fish available, very fresh, deboned and cleaned before cooking to serve. Each slice is of good size and not "discounted" like some stores. I actually dislike fish mainly because of the smell, fishy taste and usually have bones. But this store, nothing of that sort.

Each serving is not exactly cheap. I paid 15.50$ for my fish soup with yam rice, fish roe. But for the quality and freshness as well as for a person who doesn't like fish, I am regular customer.

The yam rice is very fragrant, the soup is flavourful and each serving is filling for me. Good till the last drop. Nothing is left every time I eat here üòÇ.
